commit_list.repo_description: Fork of sup with a gemspec
Fork of sup with a gemspec

commit_list.message:
reload label list on focus

This ensures the unread count for each label is correct.

I often read my list mail from the label list. When I close the thread index
and go back to the label list the unread message count is wrong. This bugs me.

I'm sure a less brutal way of doing this is possible with the UpdateManager
but that seems complicated and therefore prone to errors.
commit_list.repo_description: Fork of sup with a gemspec

commit_list.message:
fixed dlopen of libc for os x

OS X likes to do its own thing.
commit_list.repo_description: Fork of sup with a gemspec
Fork of sup with a gemspec

commit_list.message:
return sources in id-order, with non-archived sources first

To speed up the user's view of polling, deal with sources that affect
the inbox before (for example) large mailing lists. It seemed tidier to
implement this in Index rather than PollManager.

I changed "@sources.values" to "sources" in some other methods for
clarity, which I think in this case outweighs lost efficiency.
commit_list.repo_description: Fork of sup with a gemspec

commit_list.repo_description: System wide Rake.

commit_list.message:
fixed pattern matching in -T with no file given

It was broken by the error messages added in 46e27b33e44df0e66d5fd28e983cefd3cb18878f. This patch uses a simpler (and somewhat less informative) error message that matches the Sake style.
commit_list.repo_description: System wide Rake.

commit_list.message:
fixed .sake wipeout: ensure .sake is loaded before saving

This fixes the case of "sake -i foo.rake blah" where blah is not in foo.rake. No tasks match or are added, so Store#save! is the first place where tasks_file is called. Since Store.path has already been opened for writing, the tasks_file is empty.
commit_list.repo_description: System wide Rake.

commit_list.repo_description: Ruby library: adds String#titleize to properly capitalize titles

commit_list.message:
correctly match the first and last words

If the first or last word was a small word and also used elsewhere
in the title, it would be incorrectly capitalized.

For example, "the quick and the dead" was incorrectly transformed to
"The Quick and The Dead". It is now "The Quick and the Dead".

Fixes #13. Thanks to Jason Rosendale.
commit_list.repo_description: Ruby library: adds String#titleize to properly capitalize titles

commit_list.message:
handle multiple punctuated small words

A title like "Spy vs. Double vs. Instance Double" would raise an
exception. Multiple small words ("v." and "vs.") are now properly
handled.

Fixes #12. Thanks to Mauro Otonelli.

commit_list.repo_description: My hacks on the sup e-mail client
My hacks on the sup e-mail client

commit_list.message:
reload label list on focus

This ensures the unread count for each label is correct.

I often read my list mail from the label list. When I close the thread index
and go back to the label list the unread message count is wrong. This bugs me.

I'm sure a less brutal way of doing this is possible with the UpdateManager
but that seems complicated and therefore prone to errors.
commit_list.repo_description: My hacks on the sup e-mail client

commit_list.message:
fixed dlopen of libc for os x

OS X likes to do its own thing.
commit_list.repo_description: My hacks on the sup e-mail client

commit_list.message:
return sources in id-order, with non-archived sources first

To speed up the user's view of polling, deal with sources that affect
the inbox before (for example) large mailing lists. It seemed tidier to
implement this in Index rather than PollManager.

I changed "@sources.values" to "sources" in some other methods for
clarity, which I think in this case outweighs lost efficiency.

commit_list.message:
reload label list on focus

This ensures the unread count for each label is correct.

I often read my list mail from the label list. When I close the thread index
and go back to the label list the unread message count is wrong. This bugs me.

I'm sure a less brutal way of doing this is possible with the UpdateManager
but that seems complicated and therefore prone to errors.

commit_list.message:
return sources in id-order, with non-archived sources first

To speed up the user's view of polling, deal with sources that affect
the inbox before (for example) large mailing lists. It seemed tidier to
implement this in Index rather than PollManager.

I changed "@sources.values" to "sources" in some other methods for
clarity, which I think in this case outweighs lost efficiency.

repo_list.description: Active Merchant is a simple payment abstraction library used in and sponsored by Shopify. It is written by Tobias Luetke, Cody Fauser, and contributors. The aim of the project is to feel natural to Ruby users and to abstract as many parts as possible away from the user to offer a consistent interface across all supported gateways.
